question: The point of intersection of the line <katex>$x+1=\frac{y+3}{3}=\frac{-z+2}{2}$</katex> with the plane <katex>$3x+4y+5z=10$</katex> is
explanation: Check option A (2,6,-4): <katex>$\frac{3}{1} = 3$</katex>, <katex>$\frac{9}{3} = 3$</katex>, <katex>$\frac{-6}{-2} = 3$</katex>. Lies on line.
